definitions: Engaging in or performing (a crime, error, or other harmful act).
Pledging or binding (a person or an organization) to a certain course of action or policy.
Sending (someone) to prison or a psychiatric hospital.
Entrusting (something) to someone or something for safekeeping or preservation.
examples: He was caught committing the theft.
The company is committing to sustainable practices.
The judge is committing the patient to a mental institution.
She is committing her thoughts to paper.
